knimeNode.name: Geocoding
knimeNode.shortDescription: Provides latitude and longitude for given addresses.

fullDescription.intro: This node provides latitude and longitude for given addresses by using the Google Geocoding API. There is a query limit of 2,500 geolocation requests per day (100,000 requests per day for Google Maps API for Business users)).
fullDescription.option: The result of the Geocoding service is influenced by the region (typically the country) from which the request is sent. To get a result biased to a particular country, the ccTLD code for this country can be specified here. If it is the same for all rows, it can be entered in the text field. Otherwise a column containing the ccTLD codes must be used.
Google enforces a request rate for the Geocoding service. To satisfy this rate, the user can specify the delay between two request.
In some cases multiple results are returned for a single address. Several options are provided on how to perform in this case.
